arm_group.description: Neurofeedback + parental psychoeducation enhanced with social support
Self-management + parental psychoeducation enhanced with social support

brief_summary.textblock:
Neurofeedback has proved to be effective in treating Attention deficit hyperactivity
      disorder (ADHD) in experimental settings. This study investigates whether neurofeedback can
      be used as a therapeutic intervention in regular outpatient care. The investigators compare
      high frequent neurofeedback with high frequent self-management therapy and suppose that both
      result in comparable effects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  children with ADHD aged 7 to 11

          -  full command of the German language.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  IQ below 80

        Children with symptoms of:

          -  inattention,

          -  hyperactivity or

          -  impulsivity due to other medical reasons such as:

               -  hyperthyreosis,

               -  autism,

               -  epilepsy,

               -  brain disorders and

               -  any genetic or medical disorder associated with externalizing behavior that
                  mimics ADHD.

link.description: Comparison of Neurofeedback and Self-Management Training in an outpatient clinic.

facility.name: Philipps-University Marburg, Department of Psychology, Clinical Child and Adolescent Psychology

primary_outcome.description:
Children perform the Qb-Test:
T1 baseline diagnostic before therapy, 1 week
T2 post assessment after 36 therapy sessions, expected average of 12 weeks
T3 catamnestic measurement 6 months after T2
T4 catamnestic measurement 12 months after T2
primary_outcome.measure: Core ADHD symptoms (inattention/hyperacitivity/impulsivity) objectively assessed with the computer based Qb-Test (go-no-go-task with infrared camera)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-Post-Change-Design; change for core symptoms from baseline to after 12 weeks, 6 and 12 months

primary_outcome.description:
Conners parents & teacher rating scales:
T1 baseline diagnostic before therapy, 1 week
T2 post assessment after 36 therapy sessions, expected average of 12 weeks
T3 catamnestic measurement 6 months after T2
T4 catamnestic measurement 12 months after T2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-Post-Change-Design; change from baseline to psychopathology scores after 12 weeks, 6 and 12 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Either saliva sampling or blood samples for genotyping of ADHD candidate genes to establish possible correlates of therapy response

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
